author: Staff Reporter
text:
Camford International School on Sunday organised a bicycle rally to commemorate National Girl Child Day.

A release says that the objective of holding the rally was to create awareness among people on the inequalities faced by girl children in the society and highlight the steps to save them.

Around 40 boys and girls from grades nine and 10 participated in the rally to spread the awareness.

Shouted slogans

The students started off from the school at 6 a.m., and cycled for 29 km by going to Kavundampalayam, Edayarpalayam, Vadavalli, Thondamuthur, and Booluvampatti. They carried placards and also shouted slogans to draw the attention of the members of the public.

En route the students also distributed handbills.

Assistant Commissioner of Police G.S. Anitha flagged off the rally in the presence of Principal S.G. Kavitha and Chairman Arul Ramesh and Correspondent Poongothai Arul Ramesh.

In 2015, the school students had sculpted the Statue of Joy in the academic block and in 2014 they created a mosaic with 12,000 paper cups of the National Girl Child log.
title: Bicycle rally organised
